page.title: 10WIVENHOE 70 YEARS AGO
page.content: Some of us talked to an elderly inhabitant about life in Wivenhoe in the past. {Kelly:}What was different then than now? {Mrs.Allen:}Well, the schools were much different. The lessons weren't as nice as the ones you have now; not so interesting. We used to have to sand in rows and learn multiplication and spelling and if we didn't get it right we had to do it again and you know we used to get the cane if we didn't get it right. We used to get Mrs. Kestrel first of all and then Miss Kent. She was always caning us; she was very spiteful. There were Standards, not classes as we have now. We started at Standard 1 and we went up to about Standard 4 in the Infants then you went into the Juniors and you stayed there until you
